snippet: Where pay phones stand, New York City envisions thousands of “public communications structures” with free Wi-Fi service and enough telephone service for calls to 911 or 311.
abstract: David W Dunlap Building Blocks column; New York City plans to replace curbside pay phones, largely unused relics in age of smartphones, with thousands of 'public communications structures'; these structures will provide free Wi-Fi and enough standard telephone service to allow anyone to place free call to 911 or 311.
lead_paragraph: Where pay phones stand, New York City envisions thousands of “public communications structures” with free Wi-Fi service and enough telephone service for calls to 911 or 311.

headline.main: The 21st Century Is Calling, With Wi-Fi Hot Spots
headline.print_headline: The 21st Century Is Calling, With Wi-Fi Hot Spots

keywords.value: Department of Information Technology and Telecommunications (NYC)
keywords.name: organizations
